## Usando el conjunto de datos starwars mediante la libreria tidyr

```{r dplyr,message = FALSE,warning=FALSE}
library(tidyr)
library(dplyr)
```

### pivot_longer


```{r pivot_longer, echo=TRUE}
rename(starwars, names = name )
starwars %>% 
  pivot_longer(cols = c("hair_color", "skin_color"),
               names_to = "body", 
               values_to = "caracteristica")

#head(starwars)
```


### replace_na


```{r na, echo=TRUE}
sum(is.na(starwars$mass))

starwars$mass <- replace_na(starwars$mass,  0)
sum(is.na(starwars$mass))
```

### nest


```{r nest, echo=TRUE}
starwars_nest <- starwars %>% 
  group_by(species) %>% 
  nest()
head(starwars_nest)
```

```{r nest1, echo=TRUE}

starwars_nest$data[[2]]
```
